    • Method Detail

      • handleHttpError

        protected java.lang.String handleHttpError(java.net.HttpURLConnection rUrlConnection,
                                           java.lang.Exception eHttpException,
                                           HttpStatusCode eStatusCode)
        Handles an HTTP error response that has been signaled by the URL connection with an exception. The default implementation always throws an HttpStatusException but subclasses can override this method for different error handling. If the method returns a value instead of throwing an exception the value will be returned as the regular response message of this request.
        Overrides:
        handleHttpError in class HttpEndpoint.HttpRequest<ModificationSyncEndpoint.SyncData,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        rUrlConnection - The URL connection that caused the error
        eHttpException - The exception that occurred
        eStatusCode - nResponseThe response status code
        Returns:
        The request response if the error should be mapped to a regular response; else a runtime exception should be thrown
